Original_notes: slash and burn the dominant form – "tavy"
(+); passing reference: no other is given
(-); rare – only in areas of numerous wild pigs
memorial stones, of size appropriate to wealth of deceased, are dressed and raised but not marked for identification
one clan only, the Zafimaniry, imitating the Betsileo
appointed by him [underlined] - most influential of the gentile chiefs
Tanala tradition identifies loom-weaving as a borrowed trait, from the Betsimisaraka. Formerly the Ikongo dressed in soft mats, the Menabe in bark cloth
hematite pebbles picked from the soil
no silver ore, but imported silver, apparently very old, is important in Tanala culture. Gold is found but ignored
(-); twisting into spiral shape while iron is hot
